key_points: A second winter storm is hitting the South, bringing more ice and snow to Louisiana, Arkansas, Mississippi, and Tennessee.
At least 30 people have died due to the week's storms, with the new storm bringing up to 9 inches of snow in areas.
Freezing rain in Austin and San Antonio, Texas, has left everything covered in a layer of ice.
The storm moved through Oklahoma and Texas and is now affecting the Deep South.
Severe storms with potential for damaging winds, hail, and tornadoes are expected across the Gulf Coast.
Millions in Texas are without power; Houston faces a crisis with frozen and burst pipes.
Nearly 7 million people in Texas under a boil water advisory due to power outages affecting water treatment plants.
Houston hospitals face power outages and low water pressure, affecting essential medical services.
At least 22 states have delayed or canceled COVID-19 vaccinations due to the storm.
President Joe Biden spoke with governors and assured federal assistance for the affected states.
spokespersons: Judge Lina Hidalgo (the elected leader of Harris County)
Houston Chief Medical Officer Dr. David Persse
